contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox language |name=Qingtian |nativename={{lang|zh-wuu-Hans|青田話}} |states=[[People's Republic of China]] |region=[[Qingtian]] country, [[Lishui, Zhejiang|Lishui]] prefecture, [[Zhejiang]] province |speakers= |familycolor=Sino-Tibetan |fam2=[[Chinese languages|Chinese]] |fam3=[[Wu Chinese|Wu]] |fam4=[[Chuqu Wu dialects|Chuqu]] |isoexception=dialect |notice=IPA }} '''Qingtian dialect''' (={{lang|zh|青田話|p=Qīngtián huà}}) is a spoken dialect of the [[Chinese language]]. It is spoken in [[Qingtian]] county of [[Lishui, Zhejiang|Lishui]] prefecture in [[Zhejiang]], [[China]]. Qingtian dialect is of the [[Chuqu Wu dialects|Chuqu]] [[Wu dialects]] spoken in [[Quzhou]] and Lishui prefectures of Zhejiang.<ref>{{cite book |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=3qYxCjtvb24C&q=qing+tian+hua#v=snippet&q=qing%20tian%20hua%20zhejiang&f=false |title=Traditions of writing research |volume= |year=2009 |author=Charles Bazerman |editor=Charles Bazerman |publisher=Taylor & Francis |edition=illustrated |location= |isbn=0-415-99337-7 |page=154 |pages= |quote=Method Participants Eighty-four children participate in the study: 28 Chinese children, mostly from Zhejiang—a province south to Shanghai, speakers of Qing Tian Hua; 26 Moroccan children mostly from North Morocco, speakers of Darija— ie, Moroccan Arabic; |accessdate=4th of November, 2011}}</ref> It is also often spoken by overseas Chinese who are from Qingtian. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://mt.china-papers.com/2/?p=153370 A Study on the Phonetics of Qingtian Dialect] {{Chinese language}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Qingtian Dialect}} [[Category:Wu language]] {{China-stub}} {{St-lang-stub}}
